meanings.definition: To be stingy or cheap in spending money.
meanings.sent1: She always chinchiers when it comes to buying gifts.
meanings.sent2: He chinchiers on buying new clothes to save money.
meanings.sent3: The character in the movie was so chinchier that he reused tea bags.
meanings.sent4: Her grip on the purse strings was chinchier than a miser's heart.
meanings.sent5: The old man's chinchier ways were known throughout the town.

meanings.definition: A person who is overly concerned with saving money.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is known as the chinchier in our family.
meanings.sent2: The chinchier always looks for discounts and deals.
meanings.sent3: The chinchier at the office brings lunch from home every day.
meanings.sent4: She was a chinchier, hoarding every penny she earned.
meanings.sent5: The chinchier's wallet was as thin as a leaf from all the saving.
